data.title: ANATOLE FRANCE. Awarded The Nobel Prize For Literature, 1921With Lafcadio Hearn by HEARN, Lafcadio.
data.meta_description: New York 1921, Dodd. Stiff buff wrappers, blue ink titles,16 pages, 11.5 x 17.3 cm., small pamphlet with 4 essays about France, including one by Hearn, 4 black & white photographs. * * FIRST & ONLY RARE & OBSCURE EDITION * * . *** **** *** . . FIRST & ONLY RARE & OBSCURE EDITION . . . WITH HITHERTO UNPUBLISHED LAFCADIO HEARN ESSAY . * This is an obscure example, celebrating Anatole France, Awarded the 1921 Nobel Prize for Literature. . This work contains four essays by eminent novelists giving tribute to Anatole France, the man and his work, with hither to an unpublished Hearn essay. . Hearn translated two France books and admired his literary skills. The titles are: A NIGHT OF CLEOPATRA & THE CRIME OF SYLVESTRE BONNARD. . * THE FOUR ESSAYS: . 1. Winfred Stephens: ANATOLE FRANCE THE MAN . 2. Stuart P. Sherman: ANATOLE FRANCE HIS CULTURE [From the New York Herald Tribune] . 3. Lafcadio Hearn: ANATOLE FRANCE HIS ART . William Locke: ANATOLE FRANCE HIS PERSONALITY . 4. Laurence Stallings: ANATOLE FRANCE DEATH NEARS TOURAINE [From the New York World] . *** RARITY: This title is obscure and an ephemeral work. Seldom found, it is a celebration of France's Nobel Prize as well as a small collection of essays about him. . *** Color photos are posted to our website. . *** CONDITION: The work is contained in the original publisher's stiff wrappers with blue ink titles. Inside the front cover is an essay by Dodd Mead on France with a list of various editions for sale, followed by more France books on the back covers. . With "THE WORKS OF ANATOLE FRANCE IN AN ENGLISH TRANSLATION" inside the back cover, and on the back of the cover is the continuation of "Other Editions." . There is some of the usual edge chipping, closed small tears, and spine rubbing, nevertheless the pamphlet is firm and solid. . *** REFERENCE: . Not in Perkins. For other Hearn translated France titles see pp.4, 16-17 . *** . - ANATOLE FRANCE. Awarded The Nobel Prize For Literature, 1921With Lafcadio Hearn
data.text:
About this Item

New York 1921, Dodd. Stiff buff wrappers, blue ink titles,16 pages, 11.5 x 17.3 cm., small pamphlet with 4 essays about France, including one by Hearn, 4 black & white photographs. * * FIRST & ONLY RARE & OBSCURE EDITION * * . *** **** *** . . FIRST & ONLY RARE & OBSCURE EDITION . . . WITH HITHERTO UNPUBLISHED LAFCADIO HEARN ESSAY . * This is an obscure example, celebrating Anatole France, Awarded the 1921 Nobel Prize for Literature. . This work contains four essays by eminent novelists giving tribute to Anatole France, the man and his work, with hither to an unpublished Hearn essay. . Hearn translated two France books and admired his literary skills. The titles are: A NIGHT OF CLEOPATRA & THE CRIME OF SYLVESTRE BONNARD. . * THE FOUR ESSAYS: . 1. Winfred Stephens: ANATOLE FRANCE THE MAN . 2. Stuart P. Sherman: ANATOLE FRANCE HIS CULTURE [From the New York Herald Tribune] . 3. Lafcadio Hearn: ANATOLE FRANCE HIS ART . William Locke: ANATOLE FRANCE HIS PERSONALITY . 4. Laurence Stallings: ANATOLE FRANCE DEATH NEARS TOURAINE [From the New York World] . *** RARITY: This title is obscure and an ephemeral work. Seldom found, it is a celebration of France's Nobel Prize as well as a small collection of essays about him. . *** Color photos are posted to our website. . *** CONDITION: The work is contained in the original publisher's stiff wrappers with blue ink titles. Inside the front cover is an essay by Dodd Mead on France with a list of various editions for sale, followed by more France books on the back covers. . With "THE WORKS OF ANATOLE FRANCE IN AN ENGLISH TRANSLATION" inside the back cover, and on the back of the cover is the continuation of "Other Editions." . There is some of the usual edge chipping, closed small tears, and spine rubbing, nevertheless the pamphlet is firm and solid. . *** REFERENCE: . Not in Perkins. For other Hearn translated France titles see pp.4, 16-17 . *** . Seller Inventory # 85172601
